definitions.definition: a number allocated to an individual and used to validate electronic transactions.
a thin piece of metal with a sharp point at one end and a round head at the other, used especially for fastening pieces of cloth.
examples: tack, safety pin, nail, staple, fastener fasten the hem with a pin

definitions.definition: a steel rod used to join the ends of fractured bones while they heal.
a metal peg that holds down the activating lever of a hand grenade, preventing its explosion.
a peg around which one string of a musical instrument is fastened.
a short piece of wood or metal for various purposes, in particular.
examples: bolt, peg, rivet, dowel, screw a broken pin in the machine

definitions.definition: (in bowling) one of a set of bottle-shaped wooden pieces that are arranged in an upright position at the end of a lane in order to be toppled by a rolling ball.
a metal projection from a plug or an integrated circuit that makes an electrical connection with a socket or another part of a circuit.
a stick with a flag placed in a hole to mark the hole's position.

examples: she was very nimble on her pins

definitions.definition: an attack on a piece or pawn, which is thereby pinned.
examples: the pin of the black queen by the white rook

definitions.definition: attach or fasten with a pin or pins in a specified position.
synonyms: secure "she pinned the brooch to her dress"

definitions.definition: fix blame or responsibility for something on (someone).
examples: don't pin the blame on me
synonyms: ascribe to; Morelay something at someone's door; informalstick on "they pinned the crime on him"

definitions.definition: hold someone firmly in a specified position so they are unable to move.
examples: she was standing pinned against the door
synonyms: immobilize "they pinned him to the ground"

definitions.definition: hinder or prevent (a piece or pawn) from moving because of the danger to a more valuable piece standing behind it along the line of an attack.
